member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask
member.summary: The namespace contains the classes and enumerations that allow you to copy SQL Server Agent jobs from one instance of SQL Server to another.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.IfObjectExists
member.summary: Contains values used by the property of the to determine how to handle a transfer when the job exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.IfObjectExists.FailTask
member.summary: Causes the task to fail if the same job exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.IfObjectExists.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrites the job if the same job exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.IfObjectExists.Skip
member.summary: Skips the transfer of a job if the same job exists at the destination.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask
member.summary: Provides the methods and properties to transfer SQL Server Agent jobs from one instance of SQL Server to another.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.AcceptBreakpointManager(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.BreakpointManager)
member.summary: Called by the run-time engine when a task or container is created, and is passed a to enable the task to create, remove, and check the status of breakpoints. This method is called by the runtime and is not used in code.
member.param: The breakpoint manager specific to this task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.Execute(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Connections,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.VariableDispenser,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSComponentEvents,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSLogging,System.Object)
member.summary: Runs the task.
member.param: A collection of connections used by the task.
A object for locking variables.
An object that implements the interface.
An object that implements the interface.
The transaction object that the container is a part of. This value can be null.

member.summary: Initializes the properties associated with the task. This method is called by the runtime and is not used in code.
member.param: A collection of connections used by the task.
A object for locking variables.
An object that implements the interface.
An object that implements the interface.
A collection that contains events to be raised during execution of the task.
A collection of log entries.
An object reference tracker.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.LoadFromXML(System.Xml.XmlElement,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To load a package saved as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XmlElement that contains the information to be loaded.
An object that implements the interface for raising events (errors, warnings, and so on) during persistence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.ResumeExecution
member.summary: Resumes execution of the task after pausing. The task or container is resumed by the run-time engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.SaveToXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To save a package as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XML document to save the information to.
An object that implements the interface for raising events (errors, warnings, and so on) during persistence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.SuspendExecution
member.summary: Indicates that the executable needs to suspend. This method is called by the run-time engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.Validate(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Connections,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.VariableDispenser,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSComponentEvents,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSLogging)
member.summary: Verifies that the task is correctly configured.
member.param: A collection of connections used by the task.
A object for locking variables.
An object that implements the interface.
An object that implements the interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.DebugMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether a task should determine whether breakpoints are enabled.
member.returns: true if the task should determine whether breakpoints are enabled; false if the task can ignore all breakpoints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.DestinationConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets a String containing the name of the SMO connection manager for the destination database.
member.returns: A String containing the SMO connection manager.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.EnableJobsAtDestination
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether the jobs created at the destination should be enabled.
member.returns: true indicates that the jobs created are enabled. false is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.ExecutionValue
member.summary: Returns an object containing the number of jobs transfered.
member.returns: An object containing the number of jobs successfully transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.IfObjectExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value from the enumeration indicating indicating if the task should fail, overwrite the existing job, or skip the transfer of the job if a job with the same name exists at the destination.
member.returns: A value from the enumeration indicating whether the task should fail, ignore the existing job, or skip the transfer of the job, if a job of the same name exists at the destination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.JobsList
member.summary: Gets or sets a StringCollection containing the names of the jobs to transfer.
member.returns: A StringCollection containing a list of comma-delimited job names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.SourceConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets a String containing the name of the SMO connection manager for the source database.
member.returns: A String that contains the connection string of the SMO connection manager.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.SuspendRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether tasks should suspend when they encounter a breakpoint. This value is set by the run-time engine for tasks and containers when a breakpoint is encountered.
member.returns: true if the task suspends when it encounters a breakpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.TransferAllJobs
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating if some or all jobs are transferred.
member.returns: true indicates that all jobs are transferred; false indicates that only those jobs listed in the property are transferred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferJobsTask.TransferJobsTask.DtsTransferJobsException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown at load time if the persisted name of the XML root node of the task is corrupt.
